pronunciation: CONFEDERATE [Latin] United in a league; allied by treaty; engaged in a confederacy.These were confederate with Abram. Genesis 1 4:1 3.Syria is confederate with Ephraim. Isaiah 7:2.CONFED'ERATE, noun One who is united with others in a league; a person or nation engaged in a confederacy; an ally.CONFED'ERATE, verb intransitive [Latin]

definition.text: To unite in a league; to join in a mutual contract or covenant.By words men come to know one another's minds; by these they covenant and confederate The colonies of America confederated in 1 77 5.Several States of Europe have sometimes confederated for mutual safety.CONFED'ERATE, verb transitive To unite in a league; to ally.With these the Piercies them confederate
